headline: Should Albemarle’s (ALB) Kemerton Shutdown and Impairment Shift Investor Focus to Profitability Over Growth?
summary: In February 2026, Albemarle announced it had idled Train 1 at its Kemerton lithium hydroxide plant in Western Australia, following the earlier shutdown of Train 2, while confirming that 2026 production volumes would be maintained via other facilities. The move, paired with long-lived asset impairment charges of US$245.60 million and ongoing cost discipline, highlights Albemarle’s focus on profitability and capital efficiency over footprint expansion. We’ll now examine how idling Kemerton’s...
